webpage:
Past SwarmFests
Information on past meetings of the Swarm User Community.
SwarmFest 2003
SwarmFest 2003 was held at the University of Notre Dame. Please see the conference website for more details.
SwarmFest 2002
SwarmFest 2002 was held at the University of Washington. Please see the old conference website.
SwarmFest 2001
See SwarmFest 2001.
SwarmFest 2000
The Geography Department and the RSGIS Lab at Utah State University in collaboration with the Swarm Development Group, Santa Fe, New Mexico, held SwarmFest 2000 on Saturday March 11th to Monday 13th, at Utah State University in Logan, Utah.
The original call for participation can be found at the conference website:
http://www.ext.usu.edu/confer/swarmfest2000
Thanks to Irene Lee and Paul Box for getting the conference up and running, and to all who took part. Any conference followups will be posted here.
SwarmFest '99
The UCLA Center for Comparative Political Economy, in collaboration with the Swarm Program at the Santa Fe Institute, was pleased to sponsor SwarmFest '99, the third annual meeting of the Swarm User Group. SwarmFest '99 began on Saturday evening, March 27th and continued through Monday, March 29th, 1999 at the Anderson School of Management at the University of California, Los Angeles. Thanks to all who took part.
SwarmFest '98
The 2nd Meeting of the Swarm Users Group was held in Santa Fe, New Mexico on March 23-24, 1998. SwarmFest attracts researchers from diverse disciplines who have a common interest in multi-agent modelling using Swarm. Past and present Swarm developers participated in the conference.
Pictures from the conference!
SwarmFest '97
The inaugural SwarmFest was held in Feb 16-17, 1997, that brought together all the people who have been part of the Swarm development and beta processes for a free-ranging, face-to-face interchange of approaches, ideas, gripes, tale-telling, and fun! Here's the SwarmFest '97 Summary of Events.
